intro: Gyrandra pauciflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered gyra, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It is well adapted to dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Gyrandra pauciflora is often found in rocky outcrops and is valued for its ornamental appeal in arid gardens.
